PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   London 
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
PhD. Topic: The business & policy case for circular automotive & construction supply chains.  University 
of Cambridge 2013 - 2017  
• Positions: Advisor to BEIS on “Industrial Decarbonisation & Energy Efficie ncy Roadmaps”  
• Awards: EPSRC student scholarship.

MPhil. Environmental Policy (Merit)  University of Cambridge 2007 - 2008

• Posi  
  
Candidate :  Simone Cooper -Searle  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   London 
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
PhD. Topic: The business & policy case for circular automotive & construction supply chains.  University 
of Cambridge 2013 - 2017  
• Positions: Advisor to BEIS on “Industrial Decarbonisation & Energy Efficie ncy Roadmaps”  
• Awards: EPSRC student scholarship.  
• Additional Courses: Strategy, Supply Chain Management & Operations Management.  
 
MPhil. Environmental Policy (Merit)  University of Cambridge 2007 - 2008  
• Positions: Darwin College Students Association Ext ernal Officer, May Ball Committee  
 
BSc. Economics (First -class honours) University of Birmingham 2004 - 2007  
• Awards: Undergrad. prize for Economics (2005), GE Foundation Scholar -Leaders Program  
• Positions: Economics Society (Founder and President)  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
Nov 2018 – date Hydrogen Heating, BEIS  
 
May 2021 – date  
Position: Head of Strategy and Communication  
UK Government responsible for Business and Energy policy and Industrial Strategy  
• Lead a team of five to define the UK's strategy on hydrogen fo r heat, influencing the 
development of linked area of policy (h2 production, funding competitions, networks and 
storage, standards, heat decarbonisation) and providing critical challenge and support to wider 
programme (~100 people) to ensure coherence and quality.  
• Lead a team of two communications professionals on media handling, stakeholder relationship 
management, briefings for seniors and Ministers and correspondence.  
 
Nov 2018 – Apr 2021  
Position: Senior Policy Advisor, Hydrogen Strategy, BEIS  
• Drafted the UK  Hydrogen Strategy, directing a team of 20 on content development.  
• Drafted the Clean Steel Fund call for Evidence and announcement of the Low Carbon Hydrogen 
Production Fund, directing a team of 10 on content development.  
• Monitored and influenced hydro gen policy developments across 20 teams in BEIS and wider 
Government departments. Established cross -team governance to formalise approach.  
 • Significant senior level engagement with industry and civil society stakeholders.  
 
June 2017 – Oct 2018 Energy and Envir onment Programme, Chatham House  
Position : Research Lead  
Chatham House (Royal Institute of International Affairs) is an independent policy think tank.  
• Led on the design and delivery of novel research projects and partnerships related to fourth 
indust rial revo lution technologies, land use transformation and sustainable behaviours.  
• Supported Executive Director on content and strategy for new funding proposals.  
• Authored online articles and curated articles by external thought leaders.  
• Chaired and presented at expert events as a Chatham House representative.  
 
Oct 2012 – May 2017 CEED Knowledge. London, UK  
Position: Director & Co -Founder.  
Founded and ran a research consultancy comprising of early career academics during her PhD.  
• Part of consortiums that delivered rese arch projects for the World Bank, European Commission, 
Climate Change Committee, Children’s Investment Fund Foundation, Cambridge Institute for 
Sustainability Leadership and a Gulf state research organisation.  
• Advised on the business case for governance restructuring in a global NGO and for a UK 
industry association.  
• Secured funding for a UK -based academic research group and Pollinate Energy, a social 
enterprise selling solar lighting equipment in urban slums in India.  
• Expert panelist on the role of materials in a low -carbon economy at industry events in South 
Africa, Peru, Brazil and 18th UN Climate Change Conference of the Parties in Doha.  
 
Jun 2011 – Sep 2012  ICMM, London, UK  
Position: Senior Program Officer.  
ICMM is an industry association focused on minin g, minerals, metals and sustainable development.  
• Negotiated with 50 member companies to develop the mining industry’s first three -year strategy 
to reduce emissions and respond to climate change.  
• Managed the delivery of external consultancy projects on the competitiveness impacts of 
climate change policies, adaptation strategies and emissions measurement for large mining 
companies

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
